definition: to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the 1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯迅速篡夺了辛亥革命的胜利果实。

sentences.english: Indra worried that this powerful sage would one day want to usurp the position of king of heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他担心这位强有力的圣哲有一天会篡夺天帝的位置。

sentences.english: In a delicate exercise, charities are trying to present their agenda without usurping the mayor.
sentences.chinese: 慈善机构正在不篡夺市长权力的前提下，尽力想方案。

sentences.english: Though you have solemnly vowed yourself loyal to His Majesty's Court.
sentences.chinese: 丞相信誓旦旦说自己没有篡夺汉室之意。

sentences.english: Industrialism began to usurp the production and distribution functions of the family .
sentences.chinese: 工业化生产已开始篡夺家庭生产和分配的功能。

sentences.english: Surely this usurpation is more worrisome than a few federal stimulus programs.
sentences.chinese: 对权力的篡夺的担忧远胜于联邦刺激计划。

sentences.english: The fondle dog suspects the universe for scheming to take its location.
sentences.chinese: 小狗怀疑大宇宙阴谋篡夺它的位寘。

sentences.english: Other ministers even remarked that Tin Aung Myint Oo had usurped Thein Sein’s power.
sentences.chinese: 其他部长甚至评论说丁昂敏吴篡夺了吴的权力。

sentences.english: Little by little he usurped his boss's authority.
sentences.chinese: 他逐渐地篡夺老板的权力。

sentences.english: The usurper had them smashed to powder, I expect.
sentences.chinese: 我猜篡夺者将它们碾成了粉末。

sentences.english: Viserys used to call them the Usurper's dogs.
sentences.chinese: 韦赛里斯曾叫他们篡夺者的狗。

sentences.english: He was hanged for plotting to supplant the king.
sentences.chinese: 他因阴谋篡夺皇位而被绞死。

sentences.english: Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯迅速篡夺了辛亥革命的胜利果实。

sentences.english: We are the Usurpers to the Heavenly Thrones .
sentences.chinese: 我们是神圣王座的篡夺者。

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯迅速篡夺了辛亥革命的胜利果实。

sentences.english: They are usurping the Throne of God where all Judgement stands.
sentences.chinese: 他们篡夺王位上帝那里所有的判断标准。

definition: to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
(expr.) hold the feudal overlord and you control his vassals
pinyin: xie2 tian1 zi3 yi3 ling4 zhu1 hou2
